sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find the set (A △ B) △ { (1, 3), (2, 2) } and compare it with the set A △ (B △ { (1, 3), (2, 2) } ) where △ denotes symmetric difference and (a, b) represents an ordered pair of elements a and b. Show that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
